availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Franklin. Father of John L. Franklin, James H. Franklin, Benjamin F. Franklin, and Mildred Franklin. Owned one enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 28. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Precinct 5, p. 376.
